content5.ptxt: The variable nozzle vane type turbocharger operates the vacuum type actuator and controls the nozzle vane by using the VRV, which is controlled by the ECM. At a low to medium vehicle speed, when the nozzle vane moves in the closing direction and the exhaust gas rate of flow becomes faster, the engine torque increases. At a high vehicle speed, when the nozzle vane moves in the opening direction, the exhaust pressure decreases. This leads to improved fuel consumption and engine output.

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: When turbocharger boost pressure continues to be higher than ECM's target boost pressure.

item.ptxt: Extremely low battery voltage (P0560 output simultaneously)
EGR system line deposits or clogs
DPF catalytic converter or DOC catalytic converter cracks or removal

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: When turbocharger boost pressure is higher than boost pressure for a short time in which there was possibility of engine damage.

item.ptxt: Extremely low battery voltage (P0560 output simultaneously)
EGR system line deposits or clogs
DPF catalytic converter or DOC catalytic converter cracks or removal
If DTC P0234 or P1251 is stored, the following symptoms may appear.
When the nozzle vane of the turbocharger is stuck closed:
Vehicle surge when driving with full load
Low power output due to ECM limiting power output

entry.ptxt: After warming up the engine, the vehicle is driven at a constant vehicle speed at an engine speed of 2400 rpm or more for 2 minutes
After warming up the engine, fully depress the accelerator pedal for 5 seconds or more so that the engine speed is 2400 rpm or more.

item.ptxt: Inspect the fuses of circuits related to this system before performing the following inspection procedure.
After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (Click here ) and initialization (Click here ).

testgrp.testtitle: READ DTC OUTPUT (RECORD STORED DTC AND FREEZE FRAME DATA)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

test1.ptxt: Record the stored DTC and freeze frame data.

atten4.ptxt: Be sure to carefully examine "MAP" and "Target Booster Pressure" in the freeze frame data.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK ANY OTHER DTCS OUTPUT (IN ADDITION TO DTC P0234 AND/OR P1251)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

test1.ptxt: Read the DTCs.

entry.ptxt: DTC P0234 and/or P1251 are output
DTC P0234 and/or P1251 and other DTCs are output

atten4.ptxt: If DTCs other than P0234 and/or P1251 are output, perform troubleshooting for those DTCs first.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAP AND TARGET BOOSTER PRESSURE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAP and Target Booster Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Take a snapshot when the engine speed is maintained at 4500 rpm with no load.
Read the values of "MAP" and "Target Booster Pressure" in the Data List using the snapshot review function.

entry.ptxt: Difference between MAP and Target Booster Pressure is +/-15 kPa or higher

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK AIR INTAKE SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Check for air leaks and blockages between the air cleaner case and turbocharger sub-assembly, and between turbocharger sub-assembly and intake manifold.

entry.ptxt: Leaks and/or blockages exist in the intake system
No leaks and/or blockages in the intake system

item.ptxt: Inspect the air intake system, especially hoses and pipes between the air cleaner assembly and turbocharger sub-assembly.
Check for abnormal disconnections, pipe and hose squashing, and any damage in the intake system.
Using your hand, check whether the pipes and hoses in the intake system are securely connected.
By applying soapy water and revving up the engine, air leaks from the intake system can be checked by checking for bubbles.
Check for any modifications in the intake system made by the user.
Check if the vacuum hose for the manifold absolute pressure sensor is disconnected.

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE AIR INTAKE SYSTEM
READ VALUE USING GTS (MAP AND TARGET BOOSTER PRESSURE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAP and Target Booster Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Take a snapshot when the engine speed is maintained at 4500 rpm with no load.
Read the values of "MAP" and "Target Booster Pressure" in the Data List using the snapshot review function.

entry.ptxt: Difference between MAP and Target Booster Pressure is +/-15 kPa or higher

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK CONNECTION OF VACUUM HOSE

test1.ptxt: Check the turbocharger system vacuum hose connections.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT VACUUM REGULATING VALVE ASSEMBLY (FOR TURBOCHARGER CONTROL)

test1.ptxt: Inspect the vacuum regulating valve assembly (for turbocharger control).
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK TURBOCHARGER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Check the turbocharger sub-assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK HARNESS AND CONNECTOR (VACUUM REGULATING VALVE ASSEMBLY (FOR TURBOCHARGER CONTROL) - ECM)

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the vacuum regulating valve assembly (for turbocharger control) connector.
Disconnect the ECM connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.
Reconnect the vacuum regulating valve assembly (for turbocharger control) connector.
Reconnect the ECM connector.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK DIESEL THROTTLE BODY ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Actual Throttle Position and Actual Throttle Position #2.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Take a snapshot when accelerating with the accelerator fully depressed.
Read the value of "Actual Throttle Position" and "Actual Throttle Position #2" in the Data List using the snapshot review function.

specitem.ptxt: The value for "Actual Throttle Position" and "Actual Throttle Position #2" is 0%.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK ELECTRIC EGR CONTROL VALVE ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Actual EGR Valve Pos.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Take a snapshot when accelerating with the accelerator fully depressed.
Read the value of "Actual EGR Valve Pos." in the Data List using the snapshot review function.

specitem.ptxt: The value for "Actual EGR Valve Pos." is 0%.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (ACTIVATE THE VSV FOR EGR COOLER BYPASS)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and warm it up, and make sure the A/C switch and all accessory switches are off.
Turn the ignition switch off and wait for 30 seconds.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAF.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the MAF value displayed on the tester while the engine is idling.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass / Data List / EGR Cooler Bypass Position and MAF.

atten4.ptxt: Whether the EGR is passing through the bypass side or cooler side during the Active Test can be confirmed by checking EGR Cooler Bypass Position.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

data-name.name: item-name
data-name.ptxt: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass

app-param-unit.app-param: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass

test1.ptxt: Using the Active Test function, switch the EGR valve bypass switching valve between "Cooler" and "Bypass" a few times, and then check whether the MAF value changes after switching the valve from "Cooler" to "Bypass".

atten4.ptxt: If idling continues for 20 minutes or more, the EGR valve target opening angle becomes 0% (EGR valve fully closed). As this makes diagnosis impossible, it becomes necessary to drive the vehicle or restart the engine.

entry.ptxt: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass: Cooler to Bypass

item.ptxt: If the EGR cooler is clogged, the mass air flow changes.
If the bypass valve does not mechanically switch even with no clogging in the EGR cooler, the intake air flow will not change.
The bypass valve switch is determined by negative pressure changes and operating sound.
If the bypass valve does not mechanically switch, perform the repairs listed below and replace the part. Then check for changes in the intake air flow by performing the Active Test again.
Vacuum switching valve assembly (for EGR bypass valve)

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL #1 TO #8)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the values.

item.ptxt: *: The A/C switch and all accessory switches should be off, and the engine should be fully warmed up.
When the values are outside the standard range, deposits inside the injector assemblies may be causing the problem.

specitem.ptxt: Values are within the standard range.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK ANY OTHER DTCS OUTPUT (IN ADDITION TO DTC P0234 AND/OR P1251)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off and wait for 30 seconds or more.
Start the engine and warm it up for 1 minute or more.
Turn the GTS on.
Read the value of Engine Speed from the freeze frame data recorded previously.

atten4.ptxt: When performing the DTC detection drive pattern, make sure the engine speed increases to 2400 rpm or more and exceeds the "Engine Speed" value from the freeze frame data.

test1.ptxt: After warming up the engine, drive the vehicle at a constant vehicle speed at an engine speed of 2400 rpm or more for 2 minutes.
With the engine warmed up, fully depress the accelerator pedal for 5 seconds or more so that the engine speed is 2400 rpm or more.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes / Pending.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

test1.ptxt: Read the DTC.

judge-value.ptxt: DTC P0234 and/or P1251 is output

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE DIESEL THROTTLE BODY ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the diesel throttle body assembly (Bank 1 or Bank 2).
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE EGR COOLER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the EGR cooler sub-assembly.

test1.ptxt: Replace the ECM.

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the harness or connector.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE ELECTRIC EGR CONTROL VALVE ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the electric EGR control valve assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL INJECTOR OF MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injector.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the injection pipes and nozzle leakage pipe, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

test1.ptxt: Click here

test1.ptxt: Register the injector compensation code.
Click here
Perform the injector pilot quantity learning.
Click here

test1.ptxt: Replace the turbocharger sub-assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE VACUUM REGULATING VALVE ASSEMBLY (FOR TURBOCHARGER CONTROL)

test1.ptxt: Replace the vacuum regulating valve assembly (for turbocharger control).
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off and wait for 30 seconds or more.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Turn the GTS on.
Read the value of Engine Speed from the freeze frame data recorded previously.

atten4.ptxt: When performing the DTC detection drive pattern, make sure the engine speed increases to 2400 rpm or more and exceeds the "Engine Speed" value from the freeze frame data.

test1.ptxt: After warming up the engine, drive the vehicle at a constant vehicle speed at an engine speed of 2400 rpm or more for 2 minutes [A].
With the engine warmed up, fully depress the accelerator pedal for 5 seconds or more so that the engine speed is 2400 rpm or more [B].
Confirm that the DTC is not output again.

atten4.ptxt: Perform the following procedure using the GTS to determine whether or not the DTC judgment has been carried out.

test2.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Utility / All Readiness.

item.ptxt: If STATUS is NORMAL, DTC judgment is complete and the system is determined to be normal.
If STATUS is INCOMPLETE or N/A, perform [A] and [B] again.
